Posts.Content: On 7/31/2009 heartsurvivor wrote: Hello, My name is Kimberly  and scheduled for a biopsy on my left breast , in suspion of cancer.    my older sister was dignosed two years ago with breast cancer and i am worried that I may have it now....   To make matters worse I have a heart condtion at which I was born with and  have had 3 open heart sugeries!   I am just looking for some emotional support  or some one to talk too: who might be in the same boat...   Thank you , Kimberly Crawford Kimberly, I am sorry to hear you are going through this, it is difficult.  I was recently diagnosed with breast cancer, had a mastectomy, and had 8 positive lymph nodes.  When the scans and tests were done after the surgery I found out it has also spread to my bones.  Keep in mind that there are many treatments, and hopefully you will have good news from your biopsy.
Posts.Title: Emotional Support

Posts.Content: I also have stage IV bc, ER and PR +.  I was diagnosed about 2 1/2 years ago, and it had already spread to my bones.  I have been doing well, first treatment was Arimidex and once a month Zometa.  For the last year I have been getting the Falsodex shots once a month, and continuing with the monthly Zometa infusion.  I hope all of you do well, and maybe we can all live a lot longer than doctors estimate!
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Thank you for your encouragement and info. Good thing I love asparagus!
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: On Mar 02, 2012 6:35 PM tambrown72 wrote: Hello Chrisja, I was intially on Gemzar when I had my reoccurance with cancer.  This chemo made me very tired but not much nausea however it killed my immune system and left me with dangerously low WBC.  This led to me having to stop the medication because it was damaging my immune system so bad.  I wish you much luck on your journey.  Thank you for the info.  Did you have to have blood transfusions while on Gemzar?
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: One marker is at 75, the other is lower, but has been going up too.  Both my bone and CT scans were clear (Dec. 2011 and Feb. 2012).  He didn't say how long I would be on the Gemzar.  It does bother me that the scans are clear, I feel good, and so much weight is being put on the markers.  I think the doctor is being really pro-active because he terms it as "nip it in the bud", even though there does not appear to be anything to nip.  I am also surprised that the Falsodex stopped working so suddenly.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: On Mar 02, 2012 6:35 PM tambrown72 wrote: Hello Chrisja, I was intially on Gemzar when I had my reoccurance with cancer.  This chemo made me very tired but not much nausea however it killed my immune system and left me with dangerously low WBC.  This led to me having to stop the medication because it was damaging my immune system so bad.  I wish you much luck on your journey.  What treatment are you on now?  Were you given medications for the nausea?  How long were you on Gemzar?  I obviously have many questions, which I will ask my doctor, but knowing info from people who have been there is very helpful.  Thank you, and I hope you are doing well.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: On Mar 08, 2012 2:22 AM tambrown72 wrote: Hi Chris, I recently completed 10 treatments of radation to my spine due to pain from the mets.  I was on the Gemzar for about 4 months however it was not consistantly due to the fact that my WBC was often low and this fact prevented me from getting the treatment as precribed.  I was given anti-nausea meds but I found that I was not as sick with this medication.  Hope this information helps you and good luck with your treatment. Thank you for your help. I have had Gemzar twice and the nausea isn't bad. The doc told me there are other options for stage 4, but I don't know what they are or if they will work for me. I hope you are doing better.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: I made it through only one round of Gemzar, and my markers continued to go up, so next week I'm starting on Taxotere. The side effects are a concern to me. Can anyone give me info on their experience with it? I asked if I could try another estrogen blocker and I was told no because I've already tried 2, Arimidex and the Falsodex shots. Has this been the usual response for others? It seems like many of you have tried more estrogen blockers than that. Any info you can give me would be helpful. Thank you, and I hope you all are doing better every day!
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: I just found out that I will be starting chemo because even though my scans are clear, my markers keep going up.  I was stage 4, mets to bones, when diagnosed about 2 1/2 years ago.  I have been on Zometa and Faslodex for about a year, and suddenly stopped working. The chemo is going to be Gemzar, which supposedly has fewer side effects.  Has anyone been on it, and if so, how did it go for you?  I hope you all have a great day! Thanks.
Posts.Title: Beating stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: I have stage 4 bc, and find out today if it's spread to soft tissue. I have had Gemzar, taxotere, and abraxane. Only taxotere worked, but made me so anemic I had to have blood transfusions, so they took me off it. I still feel tired and weak at times from the abraxane. I am supposedly out of options. What treatments/meds is everyone else on? They won't give me ER blockers because I have had two and both stopped working. I'm ER positive. Thank you for any info you can give me on treatments and they're side effects.
Posts.Title: Stage 4 treatments

Posts.Content: On Jan 06, 2011 4:22 PM sherlaud wrote: Please, I would REALLY like to know if anyone knows much about the meaning, ranges, etc. - anything when it comes to the cancer "markers" in blood tests???????????!!!!!!!!  It seems to be a vague subject and hard to find definitive facts about.  My Dr. doesn't talk about this much - says he put more faith in the way I'm feeling.......... How you are feeling is usually the main thing doctors pay attention to, but even though I feel fine with stage 4 bc, my doctor does test for my markers every month.  They have been slowly creeping up, which concerns him, and me.  My CT and bone scan have not shown any progression.  My doctor told me that sometimes when they creep up, it could be that something is going on, but isn't enough to show on the scans, or it could mean something is about to happen.  The way my doctor explained it to me is that the markers are not dependable enough to make a diagnosis, or determine on their own if the cancer is spreading, but they are a guide that is taken into consideration with everything else.  I think the low range is around 30, and mine is now around 90-100.  There are other factors that can affect the markers.
Posts.Title: Cancer "Markers"??

Posts.Content: I also have stage 4 bc, bone mets with numerous tumors on my spine.  I thought the muscle pain in my lower back was from over doing it, but my onc. told me there can be bone pain, and/or muscle pain from the mets. Take care.
Posts.Title: Does anyone else suffer from severe muscle pains from spinal mets???????

Posts.Content: If anyone is interested in joining a cancer support group in the Liverpool, No. Syracuse, Clay, New York area, please send me a private reply.  Thank you. Judy
Posts.Title: Support group

Posts.Content: I have stage 4 bc, spread to bones.  I was on Zometa and Arimidex for about a year and a half.  When my markers went over 100 I was changed to Zometa and the Faslodex shots.  My markers are now in the 40's.  My doctor has said more than once that when this treatment stops working I should have chemo.  I did not have chemo before because the mets were present when I was diagnosed.  I have not been able to find any info regarding chemo at stage 4 when chemo was not given before.  Does anyone have any experience or info on this? Thank you!
Posts.Title: stage 4 treatment
